cards.front: What are Newton's Laws of Motion?
cards.back: First law: An object at rest stays at rest, and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and direction unless acted upon by a net force. Second law: The acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the net force acting on it and inversely proportional to its mass (F = ma). Third law: For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.

insights.title: Newton's Laws of Motion Insight
insights.takeaway: Newton's first law, or the law of inertia, states that an object at rest stays at rest and an object in motion stays in motion unless acted upon by a net force; Newton's second law, or F=ma, describes the relationship between an object's acceleration, mass, and the applied force; and Newton's third law, action-reaction principle, states that for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction

questions.stem: Which of the following is NOT a key concept in machine learning basics?
questions.rationale: Algorithm development is typically not considered a fundamental aspect of machine learning as it involves creating new algorithms, whereas data preprocessing, model selection, and feature extraction are essential steps in the machine learning process.

insights.title: Machine learning basics insight
insights.takeaway: Key machine learning concepts include supervised and unsupervised learning, neural networks, overfitting and underfitting, regularization techniques, and evaluation metrics such as accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, and ROC AUC.
